availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry Harrison McClure (Rockcastle County, Kentucky, soldier.)

body.p: Rockcastle County, Kentucky, soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Holbert McClure, Jr. Attended school in Rockcastle County, Kentucky, in 1850. Resident of Rockcastle County in 1860. Served in the 13th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from December 23, 1863, to January 10, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, Southern District, p. 169A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, p. 521.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, District 5, p. 80A.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0125.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File 31409.
